column1: zooweamama 161089318792 "2017-05-26 10:11:28 GMT" https://zooweamama.tumblr.com/post/161089318792/so-you-want-to-make-a-new-flag-for-a-community "princeofaros: Well
column2: my friend
column3: there‚Äôs gonna be a point in your life as an LGBTQIA+ person when you look at a community and think to yourself ‚Äúhey
column4: it‚Äôd be cool if I made them a flag‚Äù. After all
column5: designing shit is fun! Putting together variously colored stripes and symbols in an aesthetically pleasing yet still meaningful way has its challenges
column6: which makes it something of a test of your artistic ability. But before you go about picking your color scheme
column7: there‚Äôs something we have to go over first
column8: and that‚Äôs whether you need to do this in the first place. So let‚Äôs ask ourselves some questions
column9: yes? Here goes! First question: Is there a pre-existing flag already? For most of you
column10: that answer is no and you‚Äôre allowed to scamper on ahead and not bother with the rest of these questions. But for you few who‚Äôve decided to make a flag when there‚Äôs already a flag
column11: we‚Äôre going to have to dig deeper to see if this is necessary at all. Are you a member of this community? Most people who want to redesign community flags are members of that community
column12: but there are some folks who end up stepping out of line here. Really
column13: if you‚Äôre designing the flag for another group
column14: you should hand the job over to someone who is. No
column15: being kind of similar to actual members doesn‚Äôt make a lick of difference if you don‚Äôt actually identify yourself as belonging to that group. You should not make the flag
column16: or at the very least you should consult the members of that community on it. Is there a good reason to change it? You probably have a reason to change it
column17: but you need to really look at your reason before you commit to this. For example
column18: ‚Äúthis other older flag has one of the same color‚Äù is not a good reason. The Mexican flag and the Italian flag both have green
column20: and red. The gay flag has the entire rainbow
column21: and the bi flag shares purple and blue with it. Flags are allowed to share colors. It‚Äôs not stealing. Nobody owns colors. You don‚Äôt need to redesign a flag over that unless the flag is so similar to another flag that you can‚Äôt tell the difference. That would be a good reason. Or if a large part of the community is complaining about a detail (e.g.
column22: a lot of aromantic people were bothered by the yellow in the flag cause it was causing them eyestrain so the aromantic flag changed it to white). Does a large part of the community want a new flag? Chances are
column23: that answer is no. Unless there is something very wrong with the current flag
column24: very few will be willing to change. Your efforts will be seen as pointless at best
column25: offensive at worst. Nobody asked for a new flag
column27: nobody will want to use your flag. Do not make the flag nobody wanted. There you have it
column28: the questions you need to ask yourself before making a new flag. If your answers determine that a new flag is in order
column29: then have fun creating that new flag! Otherwise
column30: please don‚Äôt make a new flag. Please find something else to do. Please. " False text

column1: zooweamama 160198644262 "2017-05-01 18:33:10 GMT" https://zooweamama.tumblr.com/post/160198644262/i-faked-a-head-injury-to-be-able-to-use-the "brinconvenient: alx-972:  I was told that they had spoken with their attorney and had been told that I was legally required to use either the men‚Äôs room or non-gendered restrooms
column2: and that if I didn‚Äôt listen I would receive detentions
column3: and possibly more. I came prepared
column4: with printed and highlighted court cases
column6: and title IX excerpts. They didn‚Äôt listen
column7: and refused to provide notes on the meeting or confirm that they had plans to punish me. I listened for about a week
column10: and stopped. I concurrently sent a FOIA Request for the communication between the school administration and the attorney
column12: submitted another request for a clarification of what happened in the meeting and the guidance they had given me. I was called down to my dean‚Äôs office and told to calm down. I didn‚Äôt. I instead sent my principal a letter and CC‚Äôd every faculty member of importance at the school. Mr. Jay Hoffmann and Associates
column13: I regret to inform you that I sustained a mild head trauma some time before break
column14: I am in fair condition and high spirits
column15: but I must alert you to the fact that my memory was slightly affected by the incident and I have lost the ability to recall a particular event that took place in mid October
column16: 2011. While I am not completely able to remember the exact happenings of said event
column17: through a series of email searches I have managed to determine that this meeting concerned my ability to use the bathroom while attending school
column18: but I have no recollection as to what specifically happened at the aforementioned meeting. If there happened to be anything of importance said during the October meeting concerning special instructions on how I am supposed to function within the school due to your understanding of my body or identity
column19: I would like to know. Due to my active role within my community
column20: the chances of me sustaining another memory altering head injury within the near future are staggeringly high‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääif you and your staff would like to avoid explaining what happened in the initial meeting and subsequent meetings with great frequency
column22: I highly suggest that you provide me with an official letter concerning any special instructions or punitive actions to be taken against me if I fail to comply. Since this head injury
column23: I have used the school‚Äôs facilities as permitted by the Illinois Human Rights Act and will continue to do so until I am told differently in writing. Please note that any punitive actions taken against me will most likely result in a filing with the Human Rights Committee
column24: FOIA requests for all communications pertaining to the event
column27: and the raising of community awareness. I didn‚Äôt get called to the office anymore after this. In fact
column28: the administration refused to speak with me until after I graduated. I didn‚Äôt get in trouble
column30: there have been roughly a dozen other trans kids who have gone un-bothered by the administration Could this have gone differently
column31: particularly if I wasn‚Äôt in a state with laws on the books to help me? Definitely. But the point is
column32: draconian laws are much harder to enforce on people who will fight you. If you‚Äôre a trans high schooler
column33: have Title IX complaints typed up‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääyes
column34: you can still file those‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand let your administration know that you have them. Go scream at your school board until they carry you out. Show up at your principal‚Äôs office until you become a nuisance. Fax your superintendent until their machine runs out of ink. Send FOIA requests for everything you can think of
column35: costing your school time and money. They want us to cower
column36: so don‚Äôt.  I am proud to share a state with this young woman. Fantastic work
column37: @alx-972 and that‚Äôs some seriously awesome lateral thinking.¬† Congratulations on graduation and keep fighting and inspiring! " False link

column1: zooweamama 159810981892 "2017-04-21 02:13:56 GMT" https://zooweamama.tumblr.com/post/159810981892/exposed-daddyofives-abuse-of-cody "moonsandstar-s:  PSA: Please watch
column2: read
column3: and signal boost this! I cannot stress it enough. I do not normally compose posts regarding current issues
column4: but as mental abuse is a subject that is incredibly sensitive to myself and others
column5: I cannot keep silent on this and allow it to slide by without attempting to do something.¬†I would like to preface this post with a warning that the video which I have linked above contains disturbing scenes of child abuse
column10: outright traumatic behavior. If you are unable to watch these sorts of scenes
column11: I will detail them below.¬† For those of you familiar with the¬†‚ÄòDaddyOFive‚Äô situation
column12: it is a compilation taken straight from the channel with every instance of the father abusing the son
column13: Cody. For those of you who are not familiar with this
column14: allow me to break it down for you.¬†The YouTube channel called DaddyOFive is run¬†by a man blogging about his family‚Äôs everyday life and regularly uploading ‚Äúprank‚Äù videos. This man and his wife prank each other and their children
column15: who are also made to prank each other for more material they put into monetized videos. An important thing to note is that the wife is not the mother of Cody
column16: the son who is regularly abused in these videos.¬†As you will see in the video
column17: the way they treat their children -¬†especially Cody
column18: who is no older than 10 years old -¬†is sickening
column23: the monetization of child abuse veiled with the name of¬†‚Äúprank‚Äù. Pranks are meant to be amusing and
column25: mildly upsetting. They are not intended to cause extreme scarring and trauma to children
column26: but that is the only thing that results from DaddyOFive‚Äôs treatment/¬†‚Äòpranks‚Äô of his children
column27: Cody included. As one user has stated
column28: ‚ÄúHe seems to be the only one of the children who gets visibly upset over his parents‚Äô ‚Äúpranks‚Äù fairly frequently
column29: begging them to leave him alone and quit messing with him and yelling at them to stop.‚Äù¬† They constantly follow him around with their camera
column30: not giving him any personal space and filming as many of his reactions as possible to humiliate him in front of thousands of viewers.There are clips of him screaming at his son
column31: accusing him of weakness and bad behavior
column32: gas-lighting him and manipulating him into believing he is the one in the wrong. There are clips of him egging on his other children to converge on Cody and beat him up. Even more disturbing than that are instances in which the father pushes Cody face-first into a bookshelf. He is later shown sobbing on his bed
column33: with a bloody nose and a blood-splotched pillow. DaddyOFive
column35: claimed it was just red ink.¬†On top of that
column36: DaddyOFive uploaded a video titled ‚ÄúBLOCKING ALL THE HATERS‚Äù
column37: ranting about the people complaining about their videos and pointing out how horribly they treat their kids in front of his children
column38: even making sure they listen to every word he says. And this morning
column39: he uploaded yet another video which
column41: accuses the viewers of being the evil ones manipulating the children
column44: have committed no wrongdoings. The children
column46: are encouraged to believe that their parents have done nothing wrong - one child even says¬†‚Äúat least you don‚Äôt hit us like most parents‚Äù (which is not true in Cody‚Äôs case.)¬†I encourage everyone to watch this video to get a better idea of the situation. If you can
column47: that is. If at all possible
column48: please DONATE to this GoFundMe:¬†https://www.gofundme.com/save-cody-and-emma¬†It is to get Cody out of this situation and back to his biological mother
column49: and away from the horrible abuse he has to endure. Thank you. Above all

column1: zooweamama 159163645552 "2017-04-03 20:57:36 GMT" https://zooweamama.tumblr.com/post/159163645552/petition-for-the-writers-producers-of-vld-to "mcclaln:   The goal of this petition is to get precise ages for all the main characters from the Dreamworks animated series Voltron: Legendary Defender. column1: zooweamama 158357019772 "2017-03-13 16:35:45 GMT" https://zooweamama.tumblr.com/post/158357019772/measles-making-comeback-as-parents-opt-out-of "lightspeedsound: hyperzephyrianlives:  orgy-of-nerdiness:  shrewreadings:  writertobridge:  I am. So angry. Listen to me. I do not care whether or not you believe vaccines cause autism. Even though studies have shown time and time again that vaccines don‚Äôt cause autism and the original study stating that there was a link with autism and vaccines was fraudulent
column2: it does not matter. The reason that people are concerned about vaccines causing autism is because they‚Äôre not thinking of the long-term. Here‚Äôs the truth: when you are choosing to not having your child vaccinated because you‚Äôre afraid of autism
column3: you are actively choosing death over a neurodevelopmental disorder. Let me phrase that in another way ‚Äì you are either picking autism or death. It doesn‚Äôt have to be the death of your¬†child. It can be literally any child. And death is the worst case scenario. Autism is not the worst case scenario. Death is always and will constantly be the worst case scenario. There are children who are too young to get vaccines. There are kids who have compromised immune systems that cannot get vaccines. Your child getting vaccinated prevents these illnesses from spreading and keeps those children safe. It‚Äôs called community immunity and it‚Äôs important to maintain that so people don‚Äôt die. tl;dr - Stop being a selfish asshole and get your kids vaccinated. There are worse things in the world than autism. And before anyone starts coming to my inbox screaming about how¬†‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how bad autism can be‚Äù
column4: I know. Not only do I have a neurodevelopmental disorder
column5: but I also had a friend with a severely autistic brother that could not talk when he was fifteen. I know. And even after witnessing him and being through my own shit
column6: I would still get my kids vaccinated because I want them
column9: people. Why the fuck do you think that your fear of autism (ungrounded
column11: beats someone else‚Äôs RIGHT TO LIVE?!?! You don‚Äôt want to vaccinate your kid. Goody gumdrops. You expose your godchild - who‚Äôs too young to be vaccinated. You expose your sister-in-law - who is going through chemo (because having cancer isn‚Äôt bad enough)
column12: and immunocompromised. You expose everyone they¬†come in contact with¬†- BECAUSE MEASLES STAYS ACTIVE FOR UP TO TWO HOURS ON SURFACES AND IN THE AIR OF A SPACE. Number of people killed by symptoms associated with autism diagnoses: 0. Number of people killed by measles in 2015: 134
column13: 000 Number of people killed per annum before vaccination became widespread in 1980: 2
column15: 000¬†(paraphrased from WHO). (Source: World Health Organization.¬†http://who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs286/en/) VACCINATE YOUR FUCKING KIDS.  Measles is not harmless. Researchers noticed that after the measles vaccine came out

column6: or ridiculous. This is particularly for a couple of you who refuse to take a card because you know that I know that you love adjustments

column8: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a shame that it‚Äôs come to this.‚Äù  I want to thank you for the way that you are contributing to the yoga classroom as a safe space. The term ‚Äúsafe space‚Äù has taken a lot of heat in the current political milieu
column9: and it now conjures notions of catering to some impossibly fragile ‚Äúsnowflake.‚Äù But the fact is that we all need safe spaces
column10: and we need them all the time. You know when you aren‚Äôt thinking about safe space and the concept itself seems laughably unnecessary? That‚Äôs because
column12: YOU ARE IN A SPACE IN WHICH YOU FEEL SAFE. For those of us whose identities and sensibilities interface pretty seamlessly with mainstream cultural conventions
column14: and therefore invisible. But in the event that we feel threatened
column17: we come to understand what safe space really is; it is in its absence that we recognize its essence. Take
column20: whose name honors the 28% of U.S. youth between 14 and 17 years of age who report being sexually victimized in their lifetime. 1  Because of their past trauma
column21: TwentyEight has a very different relationship to touch than you or I. Touch is welcome for TwentyEight only in highly specific contexts with very close friends and intimates. Unexpected physical contact is violently triggering to TwentyEight‚Äôs nervous system and can quickly promote agonizing levels of anxiety
column23: and stress. TwentyEight has great need for the profoundly calming and grounding benefits of therapeutic yoga practice
column24: but it is often impossible to find a suitable context in which to receive them. It takes extraordinary courage for TwentyEight to show up to a yoga studio since a typical class environment is treacherous: a well-meaning instructor might lay a hand on TwentyEight in the wrong place and provoke in them a psychological space that is the exact opposite of the intended effect of the class. I really want TwentyEight to show up for class. I want them to be able to access yoga. Though I‚Äôm comfortable with touch
column25: I have my own traumas that I‚Äôve seen the practice support and transform
column26: and I have a particular affinity for people who demonstrate the fierce passion for yoga that is often a result of needing it so profoundly. So
column27: I know the cards are a little annoying
column28: particularly when you don‚Äôt need them. Many of you take my class every week
column30: and we‚Äôve talked through some really personal stuff together
column31: which makes the card seem absurd: don‚Äôt I know that you would tell me if you didn‚Äôt want an adjustment? I do know that
column32: I really do. As I‚Äôm handing you the card
column33: I‚Äôm aware that it‚Äôs probably an unnecessary exchange between us
column34: and maybe it even feels like when you lean in to hug a friend and they extend their hand so you can shake it instead. I get it. But please know this: when I‚Äôm handing you a consent card
column35: and you place it by your mat
column36: our actions are not in service of either of us. They‚Äôre in service of TwentyEight
column37: even when they‚Äôre not in the room. We are creating our own convention
column39: and my hope is that the word eventually gets out to TwentyEight that they are welcome here
column41: where they can breathe and move and seek out a little peace just like we do. And because we want to make TwentyEight (and anyone who‚Äôd prefer not to be touched for any reason) comfortable
column42: we all use the cards; I designed them so that the distinction between sides is subtle. If they need to flip their card to the No Thanks side
column43: it‚Äôs not putting them under a microscope. And that‚Äôs why everybody has to take a card
column44: and why your completely harmless jokes about them would be better left unsaid. We use the cards respectfully
column46: so that we can support those who need them. We‚Äôll know it‚Äôs working when your majority is not quite so overwhelming
column47: and more touch-averse people are finding it comfortable to practice with us. It takes tremendous skill to cultivate safe space. It requires the strength of character to be comfortable in one‚Äôs own skin while actively supporting the capacity for others‚Äô comfort. For the manly men among you who practice with me
column49: but the strongest thing you can do in my class is fortify and protect the room as a liberated learning environment for all manner of people. I‚Äôm so grateful for the way that you express and experience your physicality on your mat while holding the space with integrity for others to do the same. I want to thank all of you for hearing me out on this one. Thank you for acknowledging the value of diversity in our practice space
column50: for all of us. I love the beautiful complexity of our community
